proposed_definition: A cell shape in which the cell is cylindrical or rod-shaped, with a length typically greater than the width, and with relatively straight sides and rounded or flat ends.
reasoning: This definition follows the genus-differentia form starting with the parent class 'cell shape'. It distinguishes bacillus (rod) shape from other cell shapes (coccus, spiral, etc.) by specifying the cylindrical morphology, length-to-width ratio, and end characteristics. The term 'bacillus' refers to the morphological shape, not the bacterial genus Bacillus. This definition is clear and operationally useful for microbiologists.
